verses.esv:
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.

47:1   Clap your hands, all peoples!
    Shout to God with loud songs of joy!
verses.kjv: 1 O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.
verses.niv: 1 Clap your hands, all you nations; shout to God with cries of joy.

verses.esv:
12   “For you shall go out in joy
    and be led forth in peace;
  the mountains and the hills before you
    shall break forth into singing,
    and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
verses.kjv: 12 For ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace: the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
verses.niv: 12 You will go out in joy and be led forth in peace; the mountains and hills will burst into song before you, and all the trees of the field will clap their hands.

verses.esv:
15   All who pass along the way
    clap their hands at you;
  they hiss and wag their heads
    at the daughter of Jerusalem:
  “Is this the city that was called
    the perfection of beauty,
    the joy of all the earth?”
verses.kjv: 15 All that pass by clap their hands at thee; they hiss and wag their head at the daughter of Jerusalem, saying, Is this the city that men call The perfection of beauty, The joy of the whole earth?
verses.niv: 15 All who pass your way clap their hands at you; they scoff and shake their heads at the Daughter of Jerusalem: "Is this the city that was called the perfection of beauty, the joy of the whole earth?"

verses.esv:
19   There is no easing your hurt;
    your wound is grievous.
  All who hear the news about you
    clap their hands over you.
  For upon whom has not come
    your unceasing evil?
verses.kjv: 19 There is no healing of thy bruise; thy wound is grievous: all that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hands over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed continually?
verses.niv: 19 Nothing can heal your wound; your injury is fatal. Everyone who hears the news about you claps his hands at your fall, for who has not felt your endless cruelty?

verses.esv:
8   Let the rivers clap their hands;
    let the hills sing for joy together
verses.kjv: 8 Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together
verses.niv: 8 Let the rivers clap their hands, Let the mountains sing together for joy;

verses.esv:
37   For he adds rebellion to his sin;
    he claps his hands among us
    and multiplies his words against God.”
verses.kjv: 37 For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
verses.niv: 37 To his sin he adds rebellion; scornfully he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God."

verses.esv:
23   It claps its hands at him
    and hisses at him from its place.
verses.kjv: 23 Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
verses.niv: 23 It claps its hands in derision and hisses him out of his place.
